snippet: Mr. Abbas accused Israel of having violated the accords, which formed the basis for a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
abstract: Palestinian Authority Pres Mahmoud Abbas delivers accusatory speech at United Nations General Assembly meeting, saying Palestinians are no longer obligated to honor mutual agreements with Israel, including 20-year-old Oslo Peace Accords, backbone of Middle East peace process; analysts say pronouncement, accusing Israel of having systematically violated agreements, is expression of frustration that, if carried out, could dismantle and paralyze peace process.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from the United Nations, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Diaa Hadid contributed reporting from Ramallah, West Bank, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Abbas accused Israel of having violated the accords, which formed the basis for a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

headline.main: Mahmoud Abbas, at U.N., Says Palestinians Are No Longer Bound by Oslo Accords
headline.print_headline: Abbas Says Palestinians Are No Longer Bound by Pacts With Israel
